name: 傅遠智
objective:
The mission of Institutional Research is to support the evidence-based decision-making in education institutions. Therefore, in this course, the classmates would be asked to learn the programming language to deal with the real data and provide solid evidence to the leadership. You would be asked to fully engage in the data analysis during this semester. By the end of this course, you should be able to conduct complicated data analysis with confidence. Meanwhile, you should be able to provide productive suggestions for your supervisor's consideration.
This course not only prepare you as a qualified IR officers. It also lead you as a professional data analytician.
schedule:
Week 1: the introduction of the syllabus and course requirement
Week 2: the foundation of Institutional research 
Week 3: the working environment in Stata
Week 4: data cleaning & data manipulation
Week 5: Project Task I
Week 6: data visualization
Week 7: data modeling: multiple regression, logistic regression, quantile regression 
Week 8: data reporting
Week 9: Project Task II
Week 10: team work in PIAAC data
Week 11: team work in PISA data
Week 12: team work in administration record data
Week 13: Advanced topic I:panel data, fixed effect and random effect
Week 14: Advanced topic II: instrument variable
Week 15: quasi-experiment I: Difference in Difference, Synthetic Control
Week 16: quasi-experiment II: Regression discontinuity, Coarsened Exact Matching, Propensity Score Method
Week 17: Special talk: Geographic Information System, Social network analysis
Week 18: Project Task III
scorePolicy:
1.Project task I: 30%
2.Project task II: 30%
3. Project task III: 30%
4. class participation: 10%
materials: Angrist, J. D., & Pischke, J. S. (2008). Mostly harmless econometrics: An empiricist's companion. Princeton university press.
